slides.title: Welcome to Financial Management
slides.content:
# Financial Management & Policy

Financial management deals with **funding and investment** decisions.

## What You Will Learn

- **Capital Budgeting** - Investment decisions
- **Working Capital** - Short-term finance
- **Cost of Capital** - Financing cost
- **Policy** - Dividend and capital

## Topics

| Area | Focus |
|------|-------|
| Investment | Capital budgeting |
| Financing | Sources, structure |
| Working capital | Short-term |
| Policy | Dividend, capital |

slides.title: Capital Budgeting
slides.content:
# Investment Analysis

## Methods

| Method | Decision Rule |
|--------|---------------|
| NPV | > 0 Accept |
| IRR | > Cost of capital |
| Payback | < Target |
| PI | > 1 Accept |

## NPV Formula

```
NPV = Sum of [CF / (1+r)^n] - Initial Cost
```

## Cash Flow Components

- Initial outlay
- Operating cash flows
- Terminal value
- Working capital changes

slides.title: Cost of Capital
slides.content:
# Financing Cost

## Cost of Debt

```
Kd = Interest Rate x (1 - Tax Rate)
```

## Cost of Equity - CAPM

```
Ke = Rf + beta(Rm - Rf)
```

## WACC

```
WACC = (E/V x Ke) + (D/V x Kd x (1-T))

E = Market value of equity
D = Market value of debt
V = E + D
```

slides.title: Capital Structure
slides.content:
# Financing Mix

## Theories

| Theory | View |
|--------|------|
| MM (no tax) | Structure irrelevant |
| MM (tax) | Debt adds value |
| Trade-off | Optimal exists |
| Pecking order | Internal first |

## Financial Leverage

```
DFL = EBIT / (EBIT - Interest)
```

## Optimal Structure

Balance tax benefits with financial distress costs.

slides.title: Working Capital Management
slides.content:
# Short-Term Finance

## Working Capital

```
Net WC = Current Assets - Current Liabilities
```

## Cash Conversion Cycle

```
Inventory Days + Receivable Days - Payable Days
= CCC
```

## Policies

| Policy | Risk | Return |
|--------|------|--------|
| Aggressive | High | High |
| Conservative | Low | Low |
| Moderate | Medium | Medium |

slides.title: Cash Management
slides.content:
# Cash and Marketable Securities

## Cash Motives

| Motive | Purpose |
|--------|--------|
| Transaction | Daily needs |
| Precautionary | Emergencies |
| Speculative | Opportunities |

## Cash Models

### Baumol Model

```
Optimal Cash = sqrt(2 x T x F / r)

T = Cash required
F = Fixed cost
r = Interest rate
```

## Cash Flow Forecasting

- Receipts and payments method
- Short-term forecast

slides.title: Inventory Management
slides.content:
# Inventory Control

## EOQ Model

```
EOQ = sqrt(2 x D x Co / Ch)

D = Annual demand
Co = Ordering cost
Ch = Holding cost
```

## Reorder Level

```
ROL = Lead time x Average usage
```

## Just-in-Time

- Minimize inventory
- Pull system
- Quality focus

slides.title: Lease Financing
slides.content:
# Lease vs Buy

## Types

| Type | Features |
|------|----------|
| Operating | Short-term |
| Finance | Long-term, ownership |
| Sale-leaseback | Sell and lease |

## Evaluation

```
Compare:
- PV of lease payments
- Cost of buying (including tax)

Choose lower cost option
```

## Ind AS 116 Impact

- Right-of-use asset
- Lease liability
- On balance sheet
